articles.author: DANIEL KOZIN
articles.description: CEDAR KEY, Fla. (AP) — Idalia strengthened into a hurricane Tuesday and barreled toward Florida's Gulf Coast as authorities warned residents of vulnerable areas to pack up and leave to escape the twin threats of high winds and devastating flooding.
articles.title: Hurricane Idalia chases Florida residents from the Gulf Coast as forecasters warn of storm surge

articles.author: CHRIS MEGERIAN, TOM MURPHY and AMANDA SEITZ
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — President Joe Biden touted the potential cost savings of Medicare's first-ever price negotiations for widely used prescription drugs on Tuesday as he struggles to convince Americans that he’s improved their lives as he runs for reelection.
articles.title: 10 drugs targeted for Medicare price negotiations as Biden pitches cost reductions

articles.author: RUSS BYNUM and VALERIE GONZALEZ
articles.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — A campus security officer tipped off by observant students likely stopped the killer who fatally shot three people at a nearby Dollar General Store from carrying out his racist attack at Edward Waters University, the president of the historically Black institution said Monday.
articles.title: HBCU president lauds students, officer for stopping Jacksonville killer before racist store attack

articles.author: HANNAH SCHOENBAUM, GARY D. ROBERTSON and SARAH RANKIN
articles.description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C. (AP) — A University of North Carolina graduate student charged with killing his faculty adviser walked into a classroom building, shot the victim and then left, authorities said Tuesday, shedding light on an attack that led to a campuswide lockdown as police searched for the gunman.
articles.title: University of North Carolina graduate student left building right after killing adviser, police say

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — As John Eastman prepared to surrender to Georgia authorities last week for an indictment related to efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election, he issued a statement denouncing the criminal case as targeting attorneys "for their zealous advocacy on behalf of their clients.”
articles.title: Lawyers indicted with Trump say they were doing their jobs. But that may be a tough argument to make

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Miami Mayor Francis Suarez on Tuesday suspended his bid for the presidency, dropping out of the 2024 race after failing to qualify for the first Republican debate.
articles.title: Miami Mayor Francis Suarez suspends 2024 GOP presidential bid after failing to qualify for debate

articles.description: ST. PETERSBURG, Russia (AP) — A private burial was held for Yevgeny Prigozhin, ending a tumultuous journey from St.
articles.title: Russian mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin is buried in private, ending his tumultuous journey

articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Rep. Steve Scalise, the No. 2-ranking House Republican, said Tuesday he has been diagnosed with a form of blood cancer known as multiple myeloma and is undergoing treatment.Scalise, 57, said he will continue to serve in the House.
articles.title: No. 2 House Republican Steve Scalise is diagnosed with blood cancer and undergoing treatment

articles.author: SARAH BRUMFIELD, JAKE OFFENHARTZ and RUSS BYNUM
articles.description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla. (AP) — The Jacksonville shooter used to work at a dollar store and stopped in at one before a security guard's presence apparently led him to instead target the Dollar General down the road, where he killed three people.
articles.title: Man who killed 3 at a Dollar General in Jacksonville used to work at a dollar store, sheriff says

articles.author: BEN FINLEY
articles.description: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) — The U.S. government is trying to stop a planned expedition to recover items of historical interest from the sunken Titanic, citing a federal law and an international agreement that treat the shipwreck as a hallowed gravesite.
articles.title: A new Titanic expedition is planned. The US is fighting it, says wreck is a grave site
